# Vivek Express

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e5/Vivek_Express.jpg/200px-
Vivek_Express.jpg)](/wiki/File:Vivek_Express.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Vivek_Express.jpg "Enlarge")

Dibrugarh - Kanyakumari Vivek Express

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/19027_Vivek_Express.jpg/200px-19027_Vivek_Express.jpg)](/wiki/File:19027_Vivek_Express.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:19027_Vivek_Express.jpg "Enlarge")

19027 Vivek Express

**Vivek Express** is a chain of express trains on the [Indian
Railways](/wiki/Indian_Railways "Indian Railways") network. These trains were
announced in the [Railway Budget](/wiki/Railway_Budget "Railway Budget") of
2011-12 by the then Railway Minister. These trains were started to commemorate
the 150th birth anniversary of [Swami Vivekananda](/wiki/Swami_Vivekananda
"Swami Vivekananda"), to be held in 2013. One of the Vivek Express trains, the
one from [Dibrugarh](/wiki/Dibrugarh_railway_station "Dibrugarh railway
station") to [Kanyakumari](/wiki/Kanyakumari "Kanyakumari"); is the longest
route on the Indian Railways network, in terms of distance and time, and is
the 9th longest in the world.[1]

## List of Vivek Express
Trains[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Vivek_Express&action=edit&section=1 "Edit
section: List of Vivek Express Trains")]

As of July 2013, there are 4 pairs of Vivek Express trains

### Dibrugarh - Kanyakumari Vivek
Express[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Vivek_Express&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: Dibrugarh - Kanyakumari Vivek Express")]

Main article: [Dibrugarh - Kanyakumari Vivek Express](/wiki/Dibrugarh_-
_Kanyakumari_Vivek_Express "Dibrugarh - Kanyakumari Vivek Express")

This weekly train, numbered 15905/15906, is currently the longest train route
in the [Indian Subcontinent](/wiki/Indian_Subcontinent "Indian Subcontinent").
It joins [Dibrugarh](/wiki/Dibrugarh_railway_station "Dibrugarh railway
station") in [Assam](/wiki/Assam "Assam"), [North-East India](/wiki/North-
East_India "North-East India") to [Kanyakumari](/wiki/Kanyakumari
"Kanyakumari"), [Tamil Nadu](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu "Tamil Nadu") which is the
southernmost tip of [Mainland India](/wiki/Mainland_India "Mainland India").
It covers a total of 4286 km from Dibrugarh to Kanyakumari.

### Okha - Tuticorin Vivek
Express[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Vivek_Express&action=edit&section=3 "Edit
section: Okha - Tuticorin Vivek Express")]

Main article: [Okha - Tuticorin Vivek Express](/wiki/Okha_-
_Tuticorin_Vivek_Express "Okha - Tuticorin Vivek Express")

This too, is a weekly train, numbered 19567/19568. It connects [Okha,
Gujarat](/wiki/Okha,_Gujarat "Okha, Gujarat") (which is the westernmost tip of
India) to [Thoothukudi](/wiki/Thoothukudi "Thoothukudi"), the "Pearl City", in
Tamil Nadu in South India. This train covers 3043 km in 54:25 hours. It
travels through the states of [Gujarat](/wiki/Gujarat "Gujarat"),
[Maharashtra](/wiki/Maharashtra "Maharashtra"), [Andhra
Pradesh](/wiki/Andhra_Pradesh "Andhra Pradesh"), [Karnataka](/wiki/Karnataka
"Karnataka") and [Tamil Nadu](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu "Tamil Nadu").

This train is also religiously important, as it joins two places of religious
significance, namely [Lord Krishna](/wiki/Lord_Krishna "Lord Krishna")'s
[Dwarka](/wiki/Dwarka "Dwarka") and [Rameswaram](/wiki/Rameswaram
"Rameswaram"), which lies close to Thoothukudi.

The train covers important cities en route, namely [Rajkot](/wiki/Rajkot
"Rajkot"), [Ahmedabad](/wiki/Ahmedabad "Ahmedabad"), [Vadodara](/wiki/Vadodara
"Vadodara"), [Surat](/wiki/Surat "Surat"), [Mumbai](/wiki/Mumbai "Mumbai")
[Vasai Road](/wiki/Vasai_Road_railway_station "Vasai Road railway station"),
[Kalyan](/wiki/Kalyan "Kalyan"), [Pune](/wiki/Pune "Pune"),
[Adoni](/wiki/Adoni "Adoni"), [Bangalore](/wiki/Bangalore "Bangalore")
(Krishnarajpuram), [Salem](/wiki/Salem,_Tamil_Nadu "Salem, Tamil Nadu"),
[Karur](/wiki/Karur "Karur") and [Madurai](/wiki/Madurai "Madurai").[2]

### Bandra Terminus Jammu Tawi Vivek
Express[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Vivek_Express&action=edit&section=4 "Edit
section: Bandra Terminus Jammu Tawi Vivek Express")]

Main article: [Bandra Terminus Jammu Tawi Vivek
Express](/wiki/Bandra_Terminus_Jammu_Tawi_Vivek_Express "Bandra Terminus Jammu
Tawi Vivek Express")

This train seeks its origin from [Bandra Terminus](/wiki/Bandra_Terminus
"Bandra Terminus"), one of the main stations in [Mumbai](/wiki/Mumbai
"Mumbai"). This train, 19027/19028, like other Vivek Expresses, is also a
weekly train from Bandra Terminus, Mumbai to [Jammu Tawi](/wiki/Jammu_Tawi
"Jammu Tawi") in North India. However, unlike other typical North Indian
trains, this train bypasses [New Delhi](/wiki/New_Delhi "New Delhi") or [Delhi
NCR](/wiki/Delhi_NCR "Delhi NCR"). It goes via [Surat](/wiki/Surat "Surat"),
[Vadodara](/wiki/Vadodara "Vadodara"), [Ahmedabad](/wiki/Ahmedabad
"Ahmedabad"), [Mehsana](/wiki/Mehsana "Mehsana"), [Abu Road](/wiki/Abu_Road
"Abu Road"), [Jodhpur](/wiki/Jodhpur "Jodhpur"), [Degana](/wiki/Degana
"Degana"), [Sujangarh](/wiki/Sujangarh "Sujangarh"), [Churu](/wiki/Churu
"Churu"), [Sadulpur](/wiki/Sadulpur "Sadulpur"), [Hisar](/wiki/Hisar_\(city\)
"Hisar \(city\)"), [Ludhiana](/wiki/Ludhiana "Ludhiana"),
[Jalandhar](/wiki/Jalandhar "Jalandhar") and [Chakki Bank](/wiki/Pathankot
"Pathankot"), thus bypassing [Delhi NCR](/wiki/Delhi_NCR "Delhi NCR").

### Santragachi - Mangalore Central Vivek
Express[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Vivek_Express&action=edit&section=5 "Edit
section: Santragachi - Mangalore Central Vivek Express")]

Main article: [Santragachi - Mangalore Central Vivek
Express](/wiki/Santragachi_-_Mangalore_Central_Vivek_Express "Santragachi -
Mangalore Central Vivek Express")

The 22851/22852 Vivek Express links [Santragachhi](/wiki/Santragachhi
"Santragachhi"), a town in the vicinity of [Howrah](/wiki/Howrah "Howrah"),
[Kolkata](/wiki/Kolkata "Kolkata") in [West Bengal](/wiki/West_Bengal "West
Bengal") to [Mangalore Central](/wiki/Mangalore_Central "Mangalore Central")
in [Karnataka](/wiki/Karnataka "Karnataka"). This is also a weekly train,
which comes under the Superfast category of the Indian Railways, unlike other
Vivek Expresses. This train passes through the states of [West
Bengal](/wiki/West_Bengal "West Bengal"), [Odisha](/wiki/Odisha "Odisha"),
[Andhra Pradesh](/wiki/Andhra_Pradesh "Andhra Pradesh"), [Tamil
Nadu](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu "Tamil Nadu"), [Kerala](/wiki/Kerala "Kerala") and
[Karnataka](/wiki/Karnataka "Karnataka"). Important cities en route are
[Bhubaneswar](/wiki/Bhubaneswar "Bhubaneswar"),
[Brahmapur](/wiki/Brahmapur,_Odisha "Brahmapur, Odisha"),
[Vizianagaram](/wiki/Vizianagaram "Vizianagaram"),
[Visakhapatnam](/wiki/Visakhapatnam "Visakhapatnam"),
[Rajahmundry](/wiki/Rajahmundry "Rajahmundry"), [Eluru](/wiki/Eluru "Eluru"),
[Vijayawada](/wiki/Vijayawada "Vijayawada"), [Coimbatore](/wiki/Coimbatore
"Coimbatore"), [Kozhikode](/wiki/Kozhikode "Kozhikode") and
[Kannur](/wiki/Kannur "Kannur").

## Future plans[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Vivek_Express&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Future plans")]

Owing to the positive response to Vivek Express trains by the masses, the
[Railway Ministry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Railways_\(India\) "Ministry of Railways
\(India\)") is considering starting a new Vivek Express in the North to East
Corridor, between [Jammu Tawi](/wiki/Jammu_Tawi "Jammu Tawi") and [North East
India](/wiki/North_East_India "North East India"). Earlier Vivek Express
trains ran from East to South, South to West, West to North and again East to
South India respectively. The new North to East Vivek Express would complete
the quadrilateral; it is expected to be announced in the 2013–2014 Railway
Budget.
